result.execSummary:
The defendant Dale A Bopp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

AODA and followthrough.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Give DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dale A Bopp

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: DNA proof of submission - already on file

Defendant Dale A Bopp in court with attorney Steven Edward Weerts.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire reviewed.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to count 1.  Count 2 would be dismissed, but read-in.  Court advises party of their rights, gives citizenship/deportation admonition, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Citizenship, voting, and/or firearms information provided.  Citizenship, voting, and/or firearms information provided.  Remarks by Atty. White and Atty. Weerts.  Defendant makes a statement.  Court makes its findings and pronounces sentence.  Appeal rights given.

Sentence:  w/h sentence; $200 fine + costs = $719; $250 DNA SC and give a sample.
1 year probation w/conditions:  AODA and followthrough, follow any rules of probation, maintain absolute sobriety, 15 days jail w/work release; report to jail on 3/21/2017 @ 8 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 21, 2017 at 08:15 am.
3:20 Attny Weerts appears with defendant who indicated he wrote the wrong date on his calendar.  Has not missed any other appearances.  Warrant quashed, bond reinstated.
failed to appear 11-8-16

4:04pm Attorney Steven Edward Weerts in court.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Weerts - no idea why client is not here.  ADA White requests $750 cash or body warrant.  Court orders warrant as requested and begin forfeiture proceedings.  Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for December 8, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on November 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Dale A Bopp in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to counsel given - defendant wishes to speak with an attorney.  Defendant has contacted Atty. Petrowske.  A retainer of $1750.00 is needed and requests more time to get money together.
